meanings.definition: To give a new surface to (wood, furniture, etc.) by applying a finish again or repairing the old one.
meanings.sent1: I will refinish the old table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will refinish the wooden chair to remove the scratches.
meanings.sent3: After I refinish the dresser, it will look like it just came from a fancy store.
meanings.sent4: She refinished the antique desk, transforming it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The process to refinish the floor involves sanding and varnishing to perfection.

meanings.definition: To make (something) look new again by repairing or repainting it.
meanings.sent1: The painter will refinish the walls to cover up the old paint.
meanings.sent2: We need to refinish the fence to protect it from the weather.
meanings.sent3: He decided to refinish his bike, giving it a fresh and vibrant color.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to refinish the room, brightening up the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold strokes to refinish the mural, bringing it back to life.
